title: Blue Miracle
description: To save their cash-strapped orphanage, a guardian and his kids partner with a washed-up boat captain for a chance to win a lucrative fishing competition.

reviews.text: bad[ bad ]adjective, worse, worst;(Slang) bad·der, bad·dest for 36.not good in any manner or degree.

A man who runs an orphanage in Mexico (Jimmy Gonzales) is faced with closing down unless he can raise a lot of money. As the plot would have it, there’s a big prize fishing tournament in the area and a group of his boys becomes the crew for the crusty captain (Dennis Quaid). There’s a sweet energy with the kids providing a smidgen of personality, but the earnest approach and simple, predictable story might appeal to young audiences and their families. Interestingly, the film is set in Mexico but even the natives speak English with occasional lapses into Spanish, which makes no sense.
Es una historia verdadera muy agradable; los actores son decentes y la trama está bien; mis mejores deseos para la Casa Hogar de Cabo San Lucas.

due to lack of decent movies in netflix which vulgar words, sex and drugs gun, this is actually quite decent. we watched to see dennis quaid again. now he is just old and grumpy and wrinkled..... robert redford?it was quite heart warming and not cheesy because it touched on very relevant subject of the 'proud poor' mentality. we were shocked that there are still angels in this torn world to put up with caring for the less fortunate, when the rest are suffering just as much.the only heartache are the poor marlins, especially the one they dumped back into the sea... making us wonder whether it's a true story after all.
Inspirational true story that’s enjoyable for the whole family! Terrific cinematography and who doesn’t love Dennis Quaid?
WONDERFUL MOVIE! It’s a blessing to see actual GENUINE movies with great messages still being produced. 10/10 for me. I LOVED it.
